Course Description: This course teaches the principles and practice of drug discovery, molecular mechanics and biomolecular simulations with an emphasis on the practical skills needed to perform and interpret simulations of biological macromolecules. In addition, this course will also introduce Molecular Docking technique that is essential for Computational Drug Design.

Prerequisites.Mandatory: Basic knowledge of biology, chemistry, physics and python

Course Outcomes.CO1: Students can describe the relation of protein evolution with its function and explain fundamental structural properties.
Course Outcomes.CO2: Students can develop models of biomolecules utilizing the principles of molecular mechanics and execute small simulations of biomolecules.
Course Outcomes.CO3: Students can compute meaningful Thermodynamic and Kinetic analysis from simulation trajectory and are able to correlate the underlying connection with statistical physics.
Course Outcomes.CO4: Students can design the basic computational drug design experiments and are able to construct projects using molecular docking and simulation techniques.

Concept of molecular Force Fields and Thermostats.

Understanding the dynamics - Introduction of of simulation Molecular Dynamics. Extracting Thermodynamics and Kinetics data from simulation trajectory, understanding the concept of equilibrium in simulation.
